metadata.title: W3Schools.com

metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Shadow Effects
Shadows
With CSS you can create shadow effects!
content.html: With CSS you can create shadow effects!

content.text: CSS Shadow Effects
With CSS you can add shadow to text and to elements.
content.html: With CSS you can add shadow to text and to elements.

content.text: In these chapters you will learn about the following properties:
content.html: In these chapters you will learn about the following properties:

content.text: CSS Text Shadow
The CSS text-shadow property applies shadow to text.
content.html: The CSS text-shadow property applies shadow to text.

content.text: In its simplest use, you only specify the horizontal shadow (2px) and the vertical shadow (2px):
content.html: In its simplest use, you only specify the horizontal shadow (2px) and the vertical shadow (2px):

content.text: Text shadow effect!

content.code_html:
h1 {
  text-shadow: 2px 2px;
}

content.text: Next, add a color to the shadow:
content.html: Next, add a color to the shadow:

content.text: Text shadow effect!

content.code_html:
h1 {
  text-shadow: 2px 2px red;
}

content.text: Then, add a blur effect to the shadow:
content.html: Then, add a blur effect to the shadow:

content.text: Text shadow effect!

content.code_html:
h1 {
  text-shadow: 2px 2px 5px red;
}

content.text: The following example shows a white text with black shadow:
content.html: The following example shows a white text with black shadow:

content.text: Text shadow effect!

content.code_html:
h1 {
  color: white;
  text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px #000000;
}

content.text: The following example shows a red neon glow shadow:
content.html: The following example shows a red neon glow shadow:

content.text: Text shadow effect!

content.code_html:
h1 {
  text-shadow: 0 0 3px #FF0000;
}

content.text: Multiple Shadows
To add more than one shadow to the text, you can add a comma-separated list of shadows.
content.html: To add more than one shadow to the text, you can add a comma-separated list of shadows.

content.text: The following example shows a red and blue neon glow shadow:
content.html: The following example shows a red and blue neon glow shadow:

content.text: Text shadow effect!

content.code_html:
h1 {
  text-shadow: 0 0 3px #FF0000, 0 0 5px #0000FF;
}

content.text: The following example shows a white text with black, blue, and darkblue shadow:
content.html: The following example shows a white text with black, blue, and darkblue shadow:

content.text: Text shadow effect!

syntaxHighlighting.text:
color: white;
  text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black, 0 0 25px blue, 0 0 5px darkblue;

syntax_highlighting.text:
color: white;
  text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black, 0 0 25px blue, 0 0 5px darkblue;

content.code_html:
h1 {
  color: white;
  text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black, 0 0 25px blue, 0 0 5px darkblue;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
color: white;
  text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black, 0 0 25px blue, 0 0 5px darkblue;

content.text: You can also use the text-shadow property to create a plain border around some text (without shadows):
content.html: You can also use the text-shadow property to create a plain border around some text (without shadows):

content.text: Border around text!

syntaxHighlighting.text:
color: coral;  text-shadow: -1px 0 black, 0 1px 
    black, 1px 0 black, 0 -1px black;

syntax_highlighting.text:
color: coral;  text-shadow: -1px 0 black, 0 1px 
    black, 1px 0 black, 0 -1px black;

content.code_html:
h1 {
  color: coral;
  text-shadow: -1px 0 black, 0 1px black, 1px 0 black, 0 -1px black;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
color: coral;  text-shadow: -1px 0 black, 0 1px 
    black, 1px 0 black, 0 -1px black;

What are the minimum values required to define a text shadow?
content.html: What are the minimum values required to define a text shadow?
